noteParagraph.text: In this class, the term "vehicle" means all vehicles except those restricted to one of the following types of vehicles: rail vehicles, waterborne vessels, aircraft, space vehicles, hand carts, cycles, animal-drawn vehicles, and sledges; these types are to be found in the relevant classes . Thus, the term "vehicle" embraces vehicular characteristics which are common to more than one of the above-listed types. It also embraces certain characteristics restricted to automobile or road or cross-country trailers. The following exceptions to the above should be noted:
Sub-classes and embrace all vehicle wheels and tyres, except wheels for roller skates , wheels for model railway vehicles , and special adaptations of wheels or tyres for aircraft .
Sub-class embraces the repairing of, and the connection of valves to, inflatable elastic bodies in general, and in this respect it is not limited to vehicles.
Sub-class embraces certain electric equipment of all electrically-propelled vehicles.
Sub-class embraces certain power supply equipment for, but external to, any kind of electrically-propelled vehicle.
Sub-class relates to all kinds of vehicles, except the servicing of rail locomotives , ground equipment for aircraft , or cleaning apparatus peculiar to waterborne vessels , .

Sub-class includes brake control systems of general applicability, and in this respect it is not limited to vehicles. It also includes rail-vehicle power-brake systems and some other features of rail-vehicle brake systems.
Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .

titlePart.text: REPAIRING, OR CONNECTING VALVES TO, INFLATABLE ELASTIC BODIES IN GENERAL
DEVICES OR ARRANGEMENTS RELATED TO TYRES

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .

The term "tyre" is defined as a separate ground-engaging and continuous element surrounding the wheel rim and includes the tyre cover or jacket and any insert, e.g. tube. In the groups relating to repairing, and connection of valves, the term "tyre" is used to include other inflatable elastic bodies.
Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .

titlePart.text: VEHICLES FOR USE BOTH ON RAIL AND ON ROAD

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .

titlePart.text: ARRANGEMENTS OR ADAPTATIONS OF HEATING, COOLING, VENTILATING, OR OTHER AIR-TREATING DEVICES SPECIALLY FOR PASSENGER OR GOODS SPACES OF VEHICLES

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .

titlePart.text: WINDOWS, WINDSCREENS, NON-FIXED ROOFS, DOORS, OR SIMILAR DEVICES FOR VEHICLES
PROTECTIVE COVERINGS FOR VEHICLES NOT IN USE
titlePart.entryReference: fastening, suspending, closing, or opening of such devices

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .

The following elaborations for windows, windscreens, non-fixed roofs, doors, or similar devices are to be understood as restricted to arrangements or adaptations peculiar to the use on vehicles. Such devices of further-reaching applicability, irrespective of whether described or claimed only for vehicles, are classified in sub-class .

titlePart.text: ARRANGEMENTS OR MOUNTING OF PROPULSION UNITS OR OF TRANSMISSIONS IN VEHICLES
ARRANGEMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH COOLING, AIR INTAKE, GAS EXHAUST, OR FUEL SUPPLY, OF PROPULSION UNITS, IN VEHICLES

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .
In this sub-class:
"conjoint control of drive units" includes such control for vehicles or of general applicability;
"auxiliary drives" means drives of auxiliary or external machines or devices from the propulsion unit, transmission, or other parts of the vehicle, and includes the control of such drives;
"transmission" means all propulsion parts linking propulsion units, e.g. engines, to ultimate propulsive elements, e.g. wheels;
"drive unit" means propulsion unit conjoint with transmission, a "drive unit" can additionally include the ultimate driven unit;
"sub-unit" means, e.g., propulsion unit, clutch, gearing, or brake system.

titlePart.text: ELECTRIC EQUIPMENT OR PROPULSION OF ELECTRICALLY-PROPELLED VEHICLES
ELECTRODYNAMIC BRAKE SYSTEMS FOR VEHICLES IN GENERAL
titlePart.entryReference: electric coupling devices combined with mechanical couplings of vehicles
transmitting drive from electric motors to ultimate propulsive elements in vehicles
disposition of electric propulsion equipment, other than current-collectors, in vehicles
vehicle brake control systems in general
preventing wheel slip by reducing power in rail vehicles
coupling devices for electric connections in general
starting, controlling, braking of electric machines or converters in general

noteParagraph.text: This sub-classes deals, subject to the above references, with:
feeding of power to auxiliary circuits;
current-collectors; arrangements thereof on rail or road vehicles or on vehicles in general;
electrodynamic brake systems;
electric propulsion of vehicles; control and regulation therefor.

titlePart.text: POWER SUPPLY LINES, AND DEVICES ALONG RAILS, FOR ELECTRICALLY-PROPELLED VEHICLES
titlePart.entryReference: control of points and safety arrangements along railway lines
construction of rails and points in general

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class deals with:
overhead, overground, or underground power-supply lines; their crossings and points, erection and supervision;
devices along rails and rail joints, for current-conduction and for insulation;
safety devices along the route against earth currents and inductive interference with nearby communication lines.

titlePart.text: VEHICLE PASSENGER ACCOMMODATION NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .

titlePart.text: VEHICLES ADAPTED FOR LOAD TRANSPORTATION OR TO TRANSPORT, TO CARRY OR TO COMPRISE SPECIAL LOADS OR OBJECTS

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .

titlePart.entryReference: signal or lighting devices specially adapted for cycles

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .

This sub-class also includes electric signalling or lighting circuits so far as specially arranged in vehicles. It also includes arrangements or adaptations of lighting switches or signal-initiating means.

titlePart.text: VEHICLES, VEHICLE FITTINGS, OR VEHICLE PARTS, NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .

titlePart.text: SERVICING, CLEANING, REPAIRING, SUPPORTING, LIFTING, OR MANOEUVRING OF VEHICLES, NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .

titlePart.text: VEHICLE BRAKE CONTROL SYSTEMS OR PARTS THEREOF
BRAKE CONTROL SYSTEMS, OR PARTS THEREOF, IN GENERAL
titlePart.entryReference: brakes per se, i.e. devices where braking effect occurs, including ultimate brake actuators,

noteParagraph.text: In this sub-classe, the term "brake control systems" includes brake control systems for vehicles or of general applicability.

titlePart.entryReference: devices for short-distance movement of heavy loads by providing a high-pressure fluid cushion, supplied from an independent source, between load and ground

noteParagraph.text: The term "air-cushion vehicles" in this sub-class includes all vehicles which are wholly or partly supported on land or water by air or other gaseous cushions.
